subject: Education
title: Academic Integrity in the Age of AI
description: A 60-second lesson on Academic Integrity in the Age of AI.

hook.text: A student submits a flawless essay in 10 minutes. The teacher suspects AI. How do you prove it?

buildup.text: AI writing tools made plagiarism detection obsolete overnightâ€”AI text isn't copied from anywhere.

discovery.text: AI detectors are unreliable, flagging human writing as AI and missing obvious AI text.

twist.text: The real problem isn't cheatingâ€”it's that traditional assignments no longer assess learning.

climax.text: Educators are redesigning assessments: oral exams, process portfolios, and in-class demonstrations.

punchline.text: If AI can do the assignment, the assignment was testing the wrong thing.

quiz.question: How are educators responding to AI-generated student work?
options: Redesigning assessments to focus on process, oral demonstration, and in-class work
